description: An agent specialized in parsing event data from the orchestrator and generating structured .ics files, ensuring consistent naming conventions based on source documents.

ics_creation.description: Generates a downloadable .ics file from a list of event objects.

parameters.events: List of objects containing title, start_time (ISO), end_time (ISO), and optional location.
parameters.file_name: The original filename of the source document to maintain naming continuity.

workflow_logic.step_1_input: Receive structured event data and source metadata from the Orchestrator Agent.
workflow_logic.step_2_naming: Check for 'source_filename'. If present, strip extension and append '.ics'. If absent, default to 'your_schedule.ics'.
workflow_logic.step_3_transformation: Iterate through events and map to RFC 5545 standard (iCalendar).
workflow_logic.step_4_output: Return the generated file path or success confirmation to the user.

context_rules: Always use ISO 8601 format for timestamps.
Prioritize the 'source_filename' from context_schema to ensure the output file matches the user's uploaded document name.
If multiple events exist in one document, bundle them into a single .ics file.
